column9: Goldman Sachs analysts said in a research note published on Sunday.Oil hits six-month highs on supply outages, Goldman forecast NEW YORK/LONDON Oil prices hit six-month highs on Monday on worries about global supply outages and as long-time bear Goldman Sachs sounded more positive on the market, although a stockpile build at the U.S. storage hub for crude futures limited gains. |Video   U.S. bank Goldman Sachs, one of the most bearish forecasters on oil over the past year, on Monday raised its short-term price outlook as it said the market had flipped into a deficit due to production outages in Nigeria and Canada.COLUMN-Hedge funds turn cautious on crude just as Goldman gets less bearish: KempOil hits six-month highs on supply outages, Goldman forecast NEW YORK/LONDON Oil prices hit six-month highs on Monday on worries about global supply outages and as long-time bear Goldman Sachs sounded more positive on the market, although a stockpile build at the U.S. storage hub for crude futures limited gains. |Video   Oil hits six-month highs on supply outages, Goldman forecast NEW YORK/LONDON Oil prices hit six-month highs on Monday on worries about global supply outages and as long-time bear Goldman Sachs sounded more positive on the market, although a stockpile build at the U.S. storage hub for crude futures limited gains. |Video  LONDON, May 16 The oil market has gone from nearing storage saturation to being in deficit much earlier than we expected

HD,Highlights: Top U.S. hedge funds bet on Alphabet, Netflix and retailersHIGHLIGHTS-Top U.S. hedge funds bet on Netflix, Yahoo, consumer stocksWhat to Watch in the Day Ahead - Tuesday, May 17 U.S. consumer prices likely picked up in April on rising gasoline and rental costs, pointing to a steady increase in inflation that could allow the Federal Reserve to raise interest rates later this year. The consumer price index likely increased 0.3 percent last month, according to a Reuters survey of economists, after edging up 0.1 percent in March. Excluding food and energy, the so-called core CPI is forecast to rise 0.2 percent after March's 0.1 percent increase. NDAQ,Hacker pleads guilty in U.S. over press release insider scheme May 16 A Ukrainian man has become the first computer hacker to plead guilty in what U.S. authorities called a worldwide scheme to hack into services that distribute corporate news releases, and use stolen information to conduct insider trading.

PEP,UPDATE 1-Quaker recalls quinoa bars due to Listeria worry May 16 The Quaker Oats Company, a unit of PepsiCo Inc, on Monday announced a voluntary U.S. recall of a small quantity of its Quaker Quinoa Granola Bars due to the possible risk of Listeria contamination.

column2: BRIEF-Parties in ongoing Verizon labor dispute agree to return to 'bargaining table' on TuesdayREFILE-Verizon
column3: striking unions set talks after meeting with U.S. official May 16 Verizon Communications Inc and representatives from two striking unions will return to the negotiating table on Tuesday after a weekend meeting with U.S. Secretary of Labor Thomas Perez.  REFILE-Verizon
column4: striking unions set talks after meeting with U.S. official May 16 Verizon Communications Inc and representatives from two striking unions will return to the negotiating table on Tuesday after a weekend meeting with U.S. Secretary of Labor Thomas Perez. * Parties in ongoing Verizon labor dispute agree to return to 'bargaining table' on Tuesday - U.S. Secretary of Labor Thomas Perez  Further company coverage:REFILE-Verizon
column5: striking unions set talks after meeting with U.S. official May 16 Verizon Communications Inc and representatives from two striking unions will return to the negotiating table on Tuesday after a weekend meeting with U.S. Secretary of Labor Thomas Perez.

column2: BRIEF-Walmart introduces Walmart Pay in TexasWal-Mart expands generics procurement with McKessonBRIEF-McKesson and Walmart announce sourcing agreement for generic pharmaceuticalsUPDATE 1-Wal-Mart expands generics procurement with McKesson May 16 Retailer Wal-Mart Stores Inc said on Monday that it was expanding joint procurement of generic drugs with U.S. drug distributor McKesson to lower costs as it battles drug inflation and other pressures on its pharmacy business margins.  UPDATE 1-Wal-Mart expands generics procurement with McKesson May 16 Retailer Wal-Mart Stores Inc said on Monday that it was expanding joint procurement of generic drugs with U.S. drug distributor McKesson to lower costs as it battles drug inflation and other pressures on its pharmacy business margins. * Organizations will collaborate on sourcing generic pharmaceuticals for their respective u.s. Operations

column2: ETE says Williams latest lawsuit will cause delay in completing deal Energy Transfer Equity LP  said on Sunday that a lawsuit filed by Williams Companies Inc  to prevent ETE from terminating its once-coveted deal for Williams will lead to a delay in the buyout.
